revised_title: A New Model for Relaxation Phenomena in Imperfect Materials
tldr: The authors propose a new theory for explaining relaxation phenomena in imperfect materials, such as solids and liquids. They introduce a cluster approach that considers the structural organization of macroscopic samples and the steady-state distribution of clusters. This model helps to understand the dynamics of imperfect materials and their relaxation behavior, providing insights into dielectric relaxation spectroscopy and the structure of imperfect materials.
